--- title: "W1:Exploring a Larger Dataset" execute: warning: false error: false format: html: toc: true toc-location: right code-fold: show code-tools: true number-sections: true code-block-bg: true code-block-border-left: "#31BAE9" --- # download data ## download small cats_and_dogs_filtered.zip which have train and validation folder ::: {#9e9e8fa5 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import urllib.request urllib.request.urlretrieve("https://storage.googleapis.com/mledu-datasets/cats_and_dogs_filtered.zip", "cats_and_dogs_filtered.zip") ``` ::: ::: {#6f4d1ffe .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import zipfile # Unzip the archive local_zip = './cats_and_dogs_filtered.zip' zip_ref = zipfile.ZipFile(local_zip, 'r') zip_ref.extractall() zip_ref.close() ``` ::: ::: {#b2a7f2e3 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} from PIL import Image im = Image.open('./tmp/cats_and_dogs_filtered/train/cats/cat.0.jpg') im.size # (width,height) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ``` (500, 374) ``` ::: ::: ::: {#6abefb4d .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} import os base_dir = './tmp/cats_and_dogs_filtered' print("Contents of base directory:") print(os.listdir(base_dir)) print("\nContents of train directory:") print(os.listdir(f'{base_dir}/train')) print("\nContents of validation directory:") print(os.listdir(f'{base_dir}/validation')) train_dir = os.path.join(base_dir, 'train') validation_dir = os.path.join(base_dir, 'validation') # Directory with training cat/dog pictures train_cats_dir = os.path.join(train_dir, 'cats') train_dogs_dir = os.path.join(train_dir, 'dogs') # Directory with validation cat/dog pictures validation_cats_dir = os.path.join(validation_dir, 'cats') validation_dogs_dir = os.path.join(validation_dir, 'dogs') ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Contents of base directory: ['.DS_Store', 'train', 'validation'] Contents of train directory: ['dogs', 'cats', '.DS_Store'] Contents of validation directory: ['dogs', 'cats', '.DS_Store'] ``` ::: ::: ::: {#26cec864 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} train_cat_fnames = os.listdir( train_cats_dir ) train_dog_fnames = os.listdir( train_dogs_dir ) print(train_cat_fnames[:10]) print(train_dog_fnames[:10]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` ['cat.952.jpg', 'cat.946.jpg', 'cat.6.jpg', 'cat.749.jpg', 'cat.991.jpg', 'cat.985.jpg', 'cat.775.jpg', 'cat.761.jpg', 'cat.588.jpg', 'cat.239.jpg'] ['dog.775.jpg', 'dog.761.jpg', 'dog.991.jpg', 'dog.749.jpg', 'dog.985.jpg', 'dog.952.jpg', 'dog.946.jpg', 'dog.211.jpg', 'dog.577.jpg', 'dog.563.jpg'] ``` ::: ::: ::: {#30c8dcc3 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} print('total training cat images :', len(os.listdir( train_cats_dir ) )) print('total training dog images :', len(os.listdir( train_dogs_dir ) )) print('total validation cat images :', len(os.listdir( validation_cats_dir ) )) print('total validation dog images :', len(os.listdir( validation_dogs_dir ) )) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` total training cat images : 1000 total training dog images : 1000 total validation cat images : 500 total validation dog images : 500 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#ed59f4a7 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} import matplotlib.image as mpimg import matplotlib.pyplot as plt # Parameters for our graph; we'll output images in a 4x4 configuration nrows = 4 ncols = 4 pic_index = 0 # Index for iterating over images # Set up matplotlib fig, and size it to fit 4x4 pics fig = plt.gcf() fig.set_size_inches(ncols*4, nrows*4) pic_index+=8 next_cat_pix = [os.path.join(train_cats_dir, fname) for fname in train_cat_fnames[ pic_index-8:pic_index] ] next_dog_pix = [os.path.join(train_dogs_dir, fname) for fname in train_dog_fnames[ pic_index-8:pic_index] ] for i, img_path in enumerate(next_cat_pix+next_dog_pix): # Set up subplot; subplot indices start at 1 sp = plt.subplot(nrows, ncols, i + 1) sp.axis('Off') # Don't show axes (or gridlines) img = mpimg.imread(img_path) plt.imshow(img) plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](c2week1_files/figure-html/cell-8-output-1.png){width=1210 height=1171} ::: ::: ::: {#5698ba35 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} import tensorflow as tf import numpy as np from tensorflow import keras import os print(tf.__version__) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 2.16.1 ``` ::: ::: # Load the data ImageDataGenerator: All images will be resized to 150x150 ::: {#5c47cab0 .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} from tensorflow.keras.preprocessing.image import ImageDataGenerator # All images will be rescaled by 1./255. train_datagen = ImageDataGenerator( rescale = 1.0/255. ) test_datagen = ImageDataGenerator( rescale = 1.0/255. ) ``` ::: Image Data from directory ::: {#7f8b1530 .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.python .cell-code} # -------------------- # Flow training images in batches of 20 using train_datagen generator # -------------------- train_generator = train_datagen.flow_from_directory(train_dir, batch_size=20, class_mode='binary', target_size=(150, 150)) # -------------------- # Flow validation images in batches of 20 using test_datagen generator # -------------------- validation_generator = test_datagen.flow_from_directory(validation_dir, batch_size=20, class_mode = 'binary', target_size = (150, 150)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Found 2000 images belonging to 2 classes. Found 1000 images belonging to 2 classes. ``` ::: ::: # define convolutional model input 150 by 150 color image flow into 16 3by3 convolutional layers and 2by2 pooling output is 1 neural(0/1) sigmoid function.its good for binary ::: {#6aa1526a .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.python .cell-code} import tensorflow as tf model = tf.keras.models.Sequential([ # Note the input shape is the desired size of the image 150x150 with 3 bytes color tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(16, (3,3), activation='relu', input_shape=(150, 150, 3)), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(32, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), tf.keras.layers.Conv2D(64, (3,3), activation='relu'), tf.keras.layers.MaxPooling2D(2,2), # Flatten the results to feed into a DNN tf.keras.layers.Flatten(), # 512 neuron hidden layer tf.keras.layers.Dense(512, activation='relu'), # Only 1 output neuron. It will contain a value from 0-1 where 0 for 1 class ('cats') and 1 for the other ('dogs') tf.keras.layers.Dense(1, activation='sigmoid') ]) ``` ::: ::: {#be3b47e2 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Print the model summary model.summary() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}

tensorflow.keras.optimizers import RMSprop model.compile(loss='binary_crossentropy', optimizer=RMSprop(learning_rate=0.001), metrics=['accuracy']) ``` ::: # Callbacks ::: {#2d5c2602 .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} class myCallback(tf.keras.callbacks.Callback): def on_epoch_end(self, epoch, logs={}): ''' Halts the training when the loss falls below 0.15 Args: epoch (integer) - index of epoch (required but unused in the function definition below) logs (dict) - metric results from the training epoch ''' # Check the loss if(logs.get('loss') < 0.15): # Stop if threshold is met print("\nLoss is lower than 0.2 so cancelling training!") print("cancelling training with:") print(epoch+1) self.model.stop_training = True # Instantiate class callbacks = myCallback() ``` ::: # train model ::: {#35327930 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} history = model.fit( train_generator, epochs=8, validation_data=validation_generator,
